CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Fighting for Life - Thomas J. (Tommie) Smith, Fifth Ward constable and a deputy sheriff of Allegheny County, is shown in a Mercy Hospital bed where his is battling to live after being beaten viciously with a gun and blackjack by a nephew who attempted to kill him before taking $200 in cash and eight $50 bonds. Keeping a vigil at the hospital are Mrs. Lucille Smith, the victim's wife, and Harry Cruze, of 2154 Waring Ct., another nephew.  Ellison Smith, who inflicted the early morning robbery attack has not been apprehended as yet. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Harry Cruze and Lucille Smith leaning over bed of Tommy Smith, in critical condition after being beaten during robbery, Mercy Hospital
